channel.title: Compile and Runserver problems
channel.description:
My main problem here is that when i run my compiler (I've tried deltascape and richscape), it says
" The system cannot find the path specified"
How can this be fixed??
Also when i run the compilers they either pop open then close extremely quickly, OR it says
" ' Java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
How do i fix all this??
and i THINK it might have to do with my classpath and path, but i used the ones given in the stickied tutorial so idk.
Any help at all would be GREATLY appreciated

My main problem here is that when i run my compiler (I’ve tried deltascape and richscape), it says

" The system cannot find the path specified"

How can this be fixed??

Also when i run the compilers they either pop open then close extremely quickly, OR it says

" ’ Java’ is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.

How do i fix all this??

and i THINK it might have to do with my classpath and path, but i used the ones given in the stickied tutorial so idk.

Any help at all would be GREATLY appreciated
[/quote]I think we have a genius here!

Seriously though, how do you have 38 rep if you can’t even run a server?[/quote]

I’m on my older brothers account, and he isn’t around to help me. I’m new at this. No need to be a jackass. Don’t comment at all if your gonna be a straight up dick

item.title: Compile and Runserver problems
item.dc:creator: @shrogg shrogg
item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

hey i think i might have the awnser to your problem.
in the compiler you have

@echo off
title (your server name)
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_04\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java
pause

you either havent changed the

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_04\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java

to your verson of jdk, so what you have to do is change the “jdk1.6.0_04” to your verson, how i did this is i copy and pasted the file name in the C:\Program Files\Java folder (ie the jdk1.6.0_04) into my compiler (over wright the jdk bit)
but if you dont have jdk go to the jave website and download it and install.

cheers shrogg

Read full topic

How do i fix all this??

Any help at all would be GREATLY appreciated

Seriously though, how do you have 38 rep if you can’t even run a server?[/quote]

Reputation means nothing, it’s just a number.

Change the path in the batch files to your jdk version, and set your environmental variables.
